syllabus_info.title: Cambridge International AS & A Level Mathematics

learning_objectives.description: sketch and use graphs of the sine, cosine and tangent functions (for angles of any size, and using either degrees or radians)
learning_objectives.notes_and_examples: Including e.g. y = 3 sinx, y = 1 − cos 2x, y = tan(x + 1/4 π).

learning_objectives.description: use the exact values of the sine, cosine and tangent of 30°, 45°, 60°, and related angles
use the notations sin⁻¹x, cos⁻¹x, tan⁻¹x to denote the principal values of the inverse trigonometric relations
learning_objectives.notes_and_examples: No specialised knowledge of these functions is required, but understanding of them as examples of inverse functions is expected.

learning_objectives.description: use the identities sinθ/cosθ = tanθ and sin²θ + cos²θ = 1
learning_objectives.notes_and_examples: e.g. in proving identities, simplifying expressions and solving equations.

learning_objectives.description: find all the solutions of simple trigonometrical equations lying in a specified interval (general forms of solution are not included).
learning_objectives.notes_and_examples: e.g. solve 3 sin 2x + 1 = 0 for -π < x < π, 3 sin²θ - 5 cosθ - 1 = 0 for 0° ≤ θ ≤ 360°.
